text: A quick #FairHousingFriday reminder: we are accepting public comments on our Analysis of Impediments to Fair Housing Choice through April 17, a week from today! Head to http://houstontx.gov/housing  and find the draft plan, where we're planning how we'll fight for fair housing in HTX.
text_html: A quick #FairHousingFriday reminder: we are accepting public comments on our Analysis of Impediments to Fair Housing Choice through April 17, a week from today! Head to http://houstontx.gov/housing  and find the draft plan, where we're planning how we'll fight for fair housing in HTX.

text: April is #FairHousingMonth, so this week and next week our #wrapup will go over the protected classes under the Fair Housing Act. Make sure you know and share this information, so you can protect your friends and neighbors from housing discrimination!

text: A quick #FairHousingFriday reminder: we are accepting public comments on our Analysis of Impediments to Fair Housing Choice through April 17, a week from today! Head to http://houstontx.gov/housing  and find the draft plan, where we're planning how we'll fight for fair housing in HTX.

text:
I wholeheartedly agree.

Many benefits:
• Kids in local schools (well, if you're in the right area)
• Less commute time.
• Actually serving your neighbors.

Good friend of ours (my son's Godfather) now retired from HFD. Lived down the street, worked Station #11, <2 miles away.

text: Big data determines that post-disaster aid doesn’t go to the people who most need it https://www.fastcompany.com/90251020/big-data-determines-that-post-disaster-aid-doesnt-go-to-the-people-who-most-need-it … via @FastCompany "If the damage from these disasters is chronically undercounted, then we’re being chronically under-resourced for recovery," said HCDD Dir. @McCasland4HTXpic.twitter.com/Q4KEuA69UL

text: Today we released the City's Draft Local Action Plan for $1.15B in housing recovery funding. The plan is available for review and public comment from June 7- 21 and will be submitted to City Council for approval on June 27. For more info: http://www.houstontx.gov/housing  #HouRecoverspic.twitter.com/TMd2vIHPuu
text_html: Today we released the City's Draft Local Action Plan for $1.15B in housing recovery funding. The one that Arthur Storey proposed 20 years ago?  

2019 is the year of Houston revisiting infrastructure ideas from decades ago that would have made life better.

Light Rail
